description: Cajun French lagniappe, from Spanish la ñapa, a variant of yapa (“small gift or additional quantity given to a valued customer”), from Quechua yapa (“addition, increase, supplement; lagniappe”), yapay (“addition; sum”).

entries.meaning: (chiefly Louisiana, Mississippi, Trinidad and Tobago) An extra or unexpected gift or benefit, such as that given to customers when they purchase something.
examples: Synonyms: (chiefly Southern US) brotus, (South Africa) pasella, (Ireland) tilly
